programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights and analysis of the day's eight Premier League games, including Manchester United v Everton and Spurs against surprise top-four rivals Brighton. Manchester United had already earned league and FA Cup victories this season against Everton, who have continued to struggle away from home since Sean Dyche was appointed as manager in January. Brighton & Hove Albion are on course for the best top-flight season in the club's history, and they continued their unlikely charge for Champions League qualification with a trip to a talented but erratic Tottenham side.

programme.title: Easter Day Service - Live from Southwell Minster
programme.desc: A traditional celebration for Easter, live from the glorious setting of Southwell Minster, led by the Dean, the Very Rev Nicola Sullivan. The preacher is the bishop of Southwell and Nottingham, the Rt Rev Paul Williams. With favourite seasonal hymns and choral music, including Jesus Christ Is Risen Today and Thine Be the Glory, sung by the Cathedral Choir and congregation, directed by Jonathan Allsopp.

programme.title: Urbi et Orbi
programme.desc: On the tenth Easter of his pontificate, Pope Francis gives his Easter message and blessing, Urbi et Orbi - to the city and to the world. Petroc Trelawny sets the scene.

programme.title: My Life at Easter with Sally Phillips S1 (2/2)
programme.desc: Sally Philips meets the Rt Rev Rose Hudson-Wilkin to discover what Easter means to her.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp leads the way around Nottingham racecourse. Experts David Harper and Danny Sebastian lend a hand to the teams.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Songs of Praise (Easter Sunday)
programme.desc: «Easter Sunday»Katherine Jenkins celebrates Easter Sunday with hymns and features from Chester Cathedral.

programme.title: La mélodie du bonheur
programme.desc: Maria leaves her convent to become governess to the seven children of Captain von Trapp, a retired widower.

programme.title: Wild Isles (Freshwater) S1 (4/5)
programme.desc: «Freshwater»David Attenborough reveals the astonishing wildlife found in freshwater habitats.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Sean visits a leech farm that supplies 70 per cent of the world's medicinal leeches.

programme.title: Wild Isles (Ocean) S1 (5/5)
programme.desc: «Ocean»David Attenborough explores our mysterious seas and reveals dramatic wildlife stories.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow S45
programme.desc: Fiona and the team visit the impressive grounds of Brodie Castle in Moray.

programme.title: Great Expectations S1 (3/6)
programme.desc: Pip is thrown to the beasts of London, while Estella discovers a plan for her future.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Alex Scott introduces the goals and drama from Sunday's two games as title contenders Arsenal and Manchester City went on an Easter hunt for three precious points. League leaders Arsenal gave notice of their maturity and progress when they beat Liverpool 3-2 in October's reverse fixture, but they headed to Anfield without a top-flight win there since 2012, losing each of their past five visits. Reigning champions Manchester City travelled to struggling Southampton, who are playing under their third manager of the season and are in danger of relegation after 11 years in the Premier League.
